"I want to tell you that everyone has this force, this gravity, this pull, this attraction. And this force becomes stronger between people who are separated by distance or even death. Some may say it's the emotional connection, that feeling of missing someone, but I don't think it's that. I think people are meant to meet. I think the people who are in our lives are because of this force, the one we all obtain as we gravitate toward each other. And this force or whatever it is gets stronger as time goes on. What I'm trying to say is, whoever you're missing will find you again. Maybe not in this lifetime, but in the next. Whoever it is, you will be reunited once again." -@rmdrk, "Gravity"

Every year, I make a new tank for my squad…. We come up with little sayings that we think people would like to sport around town.
🛥
Early this year me and my pal, @devlin, started using the word “YACHTS” whenever something really cool happened. I would book a show—YACHTS. She got a promotion—YACHTS. I got an endorsement deal I believed in—YACHTS. A client reached a goal—YACHTS!
🛥
YACHTS is the new YES! We say “YACHTS” because it’s the ultimate coolest thing ever.... And it’s a little bougie, which is why we think it’s kind of funny. I was going to put “YACHTS!” on my 2018 tanks, but in the end I decided against it because when people see it without the explanation they’re going to think Lacey Stone Fitness is a team full of pretentious jerks. And we’re definitely not!
🛥
However, it is really fun to say. The next time something awesome happens to you, try it! yyyyyaaaAAACCCCCHHHHHTTTTTSSSSSSS!!!
🇬🇷
Side Bar: There will be limited edition YACHTS! tank for everyone who comes to Greece with me on my @ModernAdventurists trip! Click on my bio link for details 👌🏼

THURSDAY THOUGHTS: You know who you are 😍😂

I’m honored to be mentioned in the company of some mega powerhouse fitness brands like @Barrysbootcamp, @flywheelsports, @cyclehouse, @crossfit, and @soulcycle!!! Having a fit body isn’t just about working out and eating right anymore. The key to long-term results is building a sense of community for your students. Having good music, hot instructors, and cool gear is everywhere now, so what makes people stay committed? According to @culturetrip people want a safe place to have fun, get results, and feel good.
- - -
In my bootcamps, I’m not just thinking about my squad while they're working out with me. I’m thinking about them the entire time they are under my supervision. I give them my cell phone number because I want them to reach out to me when they feel like they’re going off track or need help with anything. I check in with everyone on my team every single day because I want them to be focused on their health and to not get distracted by temptation outside of the allotted workout times.
- - -
Call it what you want, but if you belong to a fitness studio or squad that goes above and beyond to help you succeed, I think @culturetrip got it right! I love a good fitness cult. Hahaha!

MOVE OF THE WEEK: Around-the-World Core Slams (WORKS: core and arms. 💪💪)
🔸Get in an upright kneeling position. Take the medicine ball as high as you can over your head before slamming it on the outside of the bent knee. Once the ball bounces on the ground into your hands, take it as high as you can overhead and slam it on the inside of your bent knee.
🔸Repeat this exercise for 20 reps -- 10 on the right side and 10 on the left side. Then do the same round of exercise using your other leg. Do 3 sets of this exercise on both sides.
✨TIPS: Maintain good posture throughout the entire exercise. Make sure your knee isn’t coming over the tip of your toe when your knee is bent. Be sure to engage your core during the entire exercise.

My love affair with peanut butter goes back as long as I can remember....
🥜
It’s healthier to have almond butter (which is why I’m pretending to eat it in this photo 🤪), but what the hell.... If you’re going to cheat with peanut butter, do it.

I train all of my clients to commit to their lives with their whole hearts. I train them to let go of the "I’m scared, I’m not good enough" sh*t and get the f*ck out of their own way. We all have pain, we all have struggles. My method is about owning who you are and being proud of it no matter where you are on your fitness journey. It’s about turning your pain into your strength. It’s about being proud of where you came from because it makes you who are.... And guess what? There is only one you and you’re differences and story is what makes you special.
🌟

MOVE OF THE WEEK: Reverse Lunge Medicine Ball Jumps (WORKS: legs; core; shoulders; full body, baby)
🔸Start with your feet shoulder-width apart and the medicine ball resting at your heart. Slowly take your left leg back into a lunge position. Make sure your front knee doesn’t come over the tip of your toe before you jump up in the air, pressing the med ball above your head before switching legs. Once you land on the opposite side in a lunge, repeat the same movement, alternating from left to right while pressing the medicine ball up with each repetition.
🔸Do this exercise 3 times for 1 minute each. In between sets, take 30 second-1 minute rests.
🔸TIP: I would suggest if you’re a beginner start with a 6-8 lb. ball, intermediate: 10-12 lbs., advanced: ROCK IT OUT!

MOVE OF THE WEEK: Battle ropes are badass and when you slam them into the ground, you feel rad!
💥
WORKS: When used correctly, battle ropes are a great way to light up your core and sculpt well-defined shoulders.
⚡️
There are different ways to WHIP IT. You don't have to just wave the ropes up and down. Try different motions to work different muscles and skills. I’m demonstrating the single arm wave and a double wave.
💥
Start in a squat position with your heels planted. You want to have a little slack with the rope because you don’t want to have your arms extended, and you definitely don’t want to be leaning back.
⚡️
Brace your core and begin raising and lowering your right arm explosively. Once you’ve completed 45 seconds on your right arm, repeat the same movement on your left arm for 45 seconds. Once you’ve completed your left arm, conclude the wave cycle with a double wave alternating using both your right and left arms for 45 seconds. Rest for 1 minute and repeat 2 more times.
💥

In my opinion, mental health is just as important as physical health.
💛
This week I took a couple days off to visit my parents. After a day in the desert, I realized I was beginning to lose my focus and my priorities were starting to get a little out of whack. I don’t know if I would’ve caught this had I not made a conscious effort to step outside of myself and get some perspective.
💛
What you think and where you place your focus is who you become. If you start to feel out of control and overly sensitive, it usually means you need a break. If you don’t take that break something will break you. YIKES!
💛
Being quiet and listening to yourself is one of the most overlooked areas of health. Take a couple hours today to sit in a quiet place, put your phone away, journal thoughts, read an inspiring book, and be still. You will be amazed what this simple act will do for you.

29 People came to me to help them get their fitness back on track. This isn’t The Biggest Loser, there isn't a ranch. This is real life LA Warriors wanting to get better from the inside out within their daily lives. I’m honored they came to me and I’m going to do everything in my power to help them reach their goals.
The key to success in and outside of the gym is owning your strength… Life is designed to throw curve balls, life isn’t fair at times, things will get in the way of your goals. If you truly want a great body you must commit to it… Work at it every day and enjoy the process because a great body from the inside out is a lifestyle change. A strong sexy body doesn’t come from a Quick-Fix / Short-Cut / Fad Diet / 90 Day Challenge, you know this. The body you want comes from you staying true to you and your goals. When you can trust that you will never give up on what you want and you will do whatever it takes (no cheating) to get there… There’s nothing more powerful you can do for yourself and your life. That’s Fitness.

MOVE OF THE WEEK: Overhead Lunges (TRIPLE THREAT: works lower body, core, shoulders):
🔸Choose a plate that is heavy enough to complete the move without compromising your form.
🔸Hold the plate above your head with only a slight bend in your elbow. Take alternating lunge steps forward bending your forward knee at a 90-degree angle. Make sure to not let your knee come over the tip of your toe.
🔸Complete three 30-second sets with 30 seconds of rest in between each.

My mom got me that dope pink jean jacket and from the ages of 7–11, I wore bandanas that matched my outfits. I also had no friends.
🤔
That’s my tall dad, who owned an advertising agency. One of his clients asked him to make an ad campaign for Grandpa Graf’s Soda. Their tagline was “Good guys finish thirst with Graf’s.”
🥇
Naturally my dad had me star in the commercial as a little boy with a ponytail and then he put me on billboards all over Milwaukee.
😳
I got teased at school for 3 years....
Moral of the story, even if you look stupid, you can be on a billboard if you know people.

There’s a difference between feeling satisfied and full.
🤔
1. Satisfied is when you have enough food in your belly after you’ve eaten a meal but you don’t feel like you’re about to explode.
☺️
2. Full is when you feel like you can’t even think about eating another bite because you feel like you can’t fit into your pants.
😵
Everyone should strive to feel satisfied, not full. It’s OK to be a little hungry during the day—that’s totally normal...but don’t deprive yourself to the point where you’re starving and woof down your food like a wild animal.
😆

CLASSIC CORE MOVE: Place your hands shoulder-width apart on a step (or any raised surface). Extend your legs to a 45-degree angle off the step. When your legs are fully extended, hold for a two-count before bringing them back to a tuck position.

Repeat this move for 20 reps doing a total of 3 sets.

TIPS: Have a slight bend in your elbow at all times. Be sure to keep space between your chin and your chest.

MOVE OF THE WEEK: Med Ball Explosive Long Jump with a Slam (WORKS: Legs [full-body core and plyometric cardio move]).
🔸Start with the med ball in the center of your chest right below your chin. From a squat position, jump as far as you can and land on both feet in a wide stance. Once you land, collect yourself and slowly stand with a slight bend in your knees, taking the med ball over your head. Then slam the ball into the ground while keeping your shoulders back, head up, and core tight. Once the ball bounces back into your hands, bring it to the center of your body right below your chin, shuffle back to start position, and repeat.
🔸Be sure to engage your core and land as softly as possible to not hurt your knees. Try to land on the balls of your feet rather than on your toes.
🔸Make sure the ball isn’t so heavy that it compromises your form (this can cause risk for a lower back injury!). I’m using a 10 lb. med ball.
🔸Do it 10 times in a row with a 1-minute recovery for 3 sets.

EATING HEALTHY is the missing piece of the puzzle for many of clients... They think if they just work hard enough at the gym they will get the results they deserve 💦💦💦 It's just not possible to lose those annoying 10-15-20lbs if you're not willing to change your style or eating 😦 Right now I'm on @kleanla and the keys for me are to eat meals that are gluten, soy and preservative free, and I like my ingredients to be fresh and organic. For best results I also try to stay away from dairy and alcohol. I know this sound crazy but until I accepted the healthy eating lifestyle I didn't have a body I was proud of. What I'm eating for lunch today 👆🏻 Italian Chicken Pasta Salad. Black Olives, Banana Peppers, Cherry Tomato & Broccoli. Romaine Lettuce w/ a spoonful of Basil Oregano Vinaigrette 👌🏼

WORKOUT WEDNESDAY! The ultimate multi-task (works your whole body)
🔸Using two cans of @TrulySparkling, do alternating biceps curls (swipe left), then do alternating punches as demonstrated in the boomerang.
🔸Complete 30 seconds of bicep curls followed by 30 seconds of punches as fast as you can. Rest for 30 seconds and repeat 3 more times.
🔸Once you complete the 3rd set, open one of the cans and go get a towel and clean up (in under 1 minute!) the Truly that will spray out everywhere!

MOVE OF THE WEEK: Explosive Long Jump (WORKS: Legs [full-body plyometric cardio move]).
🔸 Run into a long jump by planting both feet before jumping with all your might. Once you land, collect yourself and repeat in the other direction. Be sure to engage your core and land as softly as possible to not hurt your knees. Try to land on the balls of your feet rather than on your toes.
🔸 Do 10 long jumps in a row with a 1-minute recovery for 3 sets.

MOVE OF THE WEEK: Monster Jumps (WORKS: Legs [full-body cardio move])
🔸 Starting on one leg, jump as far as you can diagonally to the other leg, landing in a double hop. Once you've completed the double hop, pause on your third hop for a moment before you take another monster jump.
🔸 Make sure when you execute the exercise that you stay light on your feet and have a slight bend in your knee. Also, do your best to land on the balls of your feet and not your tippy toes so you don't risk hurting your knees.
🔸 Do 10 monster jumps in a row with a 1-minute recovery for 3 sets.

MOVE OF THE WEEK: WORKS (The Peach)
🍑 Get in a half-squat position with a slight bend in your knees. Make sure your knees aren't coming over the tip of your toes, and keep your feet facing forward (not out to the side) once you start moving laterally. I recommend you take 16 baby steps to the left and then 16 baby steps to the right, keeping your feet shoulder-width apart with every step.
🍑 Do 1 set of 16 steps to the right and left 4x total. Repeat this exercise 2x with 1 minute of rest in between each round.

I got hit with a nasty cold and everyone keeps telling me to have chicken soup.... Is chicken soup really that healing? The answer is yes, and here are some reasons why.
🤧
🔹Cleansing: When you’re battling antibodies, the fluid of the soup helps flush them out.
🔹Disinfecting: Chicken soup is generally salty, so when it goes down the throat it acts in much the same way salt water does removing bacteria in the throat.
🔹Clears sinuses: The warm liquid can help clear the sinuses with the steam.
🔹Strengthening: The lean protein in the chicken and the nutrients in the added vegetables work to bolster your strength when you’re drained of energy.
🥣

Shoutout to my grandfather, Papa Sid. He fled from Germany to America as a teenager and didn't speak a lick of English. To make money, he'd knock on the doors of local businesses and ask to draw their business signs and logos. He did such a great job and had such a charismatic personality that a television producer asked him if he'd be interested in being on a show called "It's A Draw." The show became wildly successful and my grandfather was officially a self-made man. I often think of him and get inspired by his courage to follow his destiny and trust that life would take care of the rest. Papa Sid epitomized magic. ✨✨✨✨✨

MOVE OF THE WEEK: Full Figure-8 Lunge Jumps (WORKS: legs, abs, full body)
🔸Start in a lunge position left leg forward and the ball in your right hand. While in a lunge, pass the med ball from your right hand to your left hand underneath your left leg. Once you gain control over the ball in your left hand, explode off the ground tossing the ball overhead into the right hand, simultaneously bringing your right leg forward into a lunge position. Once you’ve regained your balance, pass the ball under your forward leg into your opposite hand and repeat these movements until the end of the round.
🔸Perform 3 sets for 1 minute each.
🔸SPOILER ALERT: This exercise is challenging but worth the effort. The more you do it, the better you’ll get. Let me know how it goes!

MOVE OF THE WEEK: High-Knee Drills (WORKS: thighs, hips, balance, heart)
🔸Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart. Explosively run forward about 10 feet, alternately lifting each leg as high toward your chest as possible.
🔸Back pedal to starting position and repeat.
🔸Perform this exercise 3 times for 45 seconds each with 30 seconds of rest in between. Doing this move regularly will help you develop a longer stride and become a more efficient runner.
.
🔹TRAINER TIP: Make sure to wear high-performance leggings that stay up while you move to avoid showing the whole gym your ass…unless you’re into that sort of thing. 😏

WORKOUT WEDNESDAY!!! It's core month homies, let me demonstrate this sick move for you. Be sure to maintain balance on the bosu by pushing your core and the small of your back into the unstable half-moon along with planting your non-working leg on the floor. The key is the flexion and extension of you spinal cord will doing the exercise. Remember to breathe, and do not shorten the movement while doing the exercise. Full range of motion is the name of the game. Do 12-15 reps on both the Right & Left Side 3X. Do this exercise at least 3 times this week.

Increase the number of reps every time you do it ***Do the exercise at least 4 more times before December.

Guess who? 😆 When people meet me now they think that having a great body is easy for me. They ask, “How can I get your arms?” You must look at fitness as a long game and not a quick fix. You must find the determination to make sacrifices to change unhealthy habits to healthy ones.
💪🏼💪🏼
I do cardio workouts 7x/week, lift weights 2-3x week, rarely drink alcohol, get 8 hours of sleep, drink lots of water, and eat healthy low-carb foods at every meal. I get out of bed before the sun comes up because I'm committed to my goals. Being fit isn't given to anyone, it’s earned.
🏅🏆
This is what it takes to have a great body for someone who wasn’t blessed with great genes. It takes courage, stamina, patience, drive, and belief in yourself. If you're willing to put in the work, you will reach your goals and then some.

My name is Lacey Stone and I’m a workaholic. Don’t get me wrong—I love what I do—but sometimes I feel like I’d be lost if I weren’t working. And coming from someone who preaches balance, that’s NOT GOOD. There is a stigma surrounding many addictions yet being a workaholic is celebrated and I think that’s so wrong....
😬
Which brings me to @artworksstudio, which my friend @cyndifinkle owns. She invited me to Paint & Sip where people come and get inspiration from famous pieces of artwork while sipping on wine and listening to jazz. As soon as I entered the studio, memories swept over me like a warm blanket. When I was a kid, my mom took me to art classes whenever I had a break in sports seasons. Until I walked into that studio, I had forgotten what a big part of my life I had let go.
🎨
Balance is so important. Achieving success is rad af, but if you do it at all costs you’ll come to find you didn’t understand what real success is at all. Balance creates happiness, and happiness is true success.
❤️

MOVE OF THE WEEK: Alternating Medicine Ball Toss (WORKS: Core, Arms, Legs. It’s full body, baby.) I played basketball in college, which is why I LOVE to incorporate medicine balls and a lot of athleticism into my workouts. ⛹🏼‍♀️
🔸Grab a medicine ball that’s heavy but not too heavy that you can’t execute the movement properly.
🔸Get into a squat position, and cradle the medicine ball with one hand. As you come up to standing position, simultaneously toss the med ball into the air as high as you can. Once the med ball starts coming back down, jump as high as you can from standing position to retrieve the ball (like you’re getting a rebound 🏀.)
🔸Once you land, return to start position and repeat the move on the opposite side.
🔸Do this exercise 3X for 10 reps on each side with a 1-minute recovery in between sets. --

MOVE OF THE WEEK: Rainbow Medicine Ball Toss (WORKS: Core [and is fun as sh*t])
🔸Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, and hold the medicine ball in the center of your body parallel to your heart with a slight bend in your elbows. Slowly pivot to your right keeping your core engaged while you swing-toss the medicine ball into the wall as hard as you can. Once the ball bounces back into your hands, return to start position and repeat on the other side. Do 20 tosses (10 on each side) for 3 sets. 🔸 TIP: Keep good athletic posture throughout the exercise by not letting your upper back slouch. It bothers me so much when people have bad form. No one should EVER get hurt working out. The only reason you would get hurt is if you have terrible form or if you’re trying to lift too heavy of a weight. When you get injured, you should immediately work one-on-one with a trainer to correct what’s going wrong and possibly see a doctor in case something else is going on with your body. There’s no honor in getting injured at the gym; be smart and slow down.

There’s a wrong way to eat and a better way to eat. Let me explain by giving you a tour of my breakfast below.
🍳
Eggs = awesome.👌🏼 The jury’s out about about egg whites and egg yolks...the cholesterol isn’t awesome but I eat the whole damn thing, whatever.
🍅👌🏼🥑
Tomatoes rock and I love avocados—the healthy fat is on point.
🙆🏼‍♀️
That weird onion ring shit on the top of my eggs is not good. I will take my fork and put it on a side plate.
🍞
I love bread. Carbs give you energy to get through your day. However, I’m eating the wheat bread, not the white bread because it’s it’s easier to digest.
🤷🏼‍♀️
Butter vs. olive oil. Fats are good for you, yo! Olive oil is better but good old-fashioned butter is not bad for you if eaten sparingly. In fact, fat is good for your diet!

Treat yourself like a baby…. When you’re tired, take a nap or go to sleep early. When you’re upset, let yourself cry. When you’re angry, find a safe place and scream. When you’re happy, spread it like wild fire. Eat healthy food that’s good for you. Go to the gym and “play.” When you’re achey, get a massage. If you don’t know how to do something, hire a tutor. When you’re sick, go to the doctor. When you’re sad, do something fun.
💃🏼
Why when we get older do we stop taking care of ourselves the way we should? I fall victim to the “I’m too busy excuse” too, but the fact is, the older we get, the more we need to go back to basics because long-term complications occur when you don’t take care of yourself. Love yourself like you would love your own child or any child. We all have magic inside of us.... Give your body and spirit the chance to use it.
💫

MOVE OF THE WEEK: 1 Minute Acceleration Sprint with Resistance Running Bands (improves running form and works core, posture, and legs)
.
This exercise makes me fill like a racehorse and La is my jockey. 🏇🏻 If you’re looking to improve your mechanics, power, and speed while running, this exercise is for you.
🔸Assume a starting sprint position, leaning forward at a 45-degree angle.
🔸Attach a resistance band around your waist.
🔸Have your partner stand behind you holding the resistance band securely in both hands.
🔸Sprint forward as fast and as hard as you can while your partner stands firm behind you, holding onto the band to provide steady resistance.
🐎🐎🐎🐎
Do this exercise 3 times for 1 minute each. In between sets, rest for 30 seconds-1 minute.
.

❤️
They put me in sports to learn hard work, teamwork, honest communication, and leadership. They supported me no matter what I did or what the world threw at me, which taught me unconditional love. And they put me in art classes to express my creative side. The hard work, honesty, teamwork, communication, leadership, love, and creativity I learned as a child gave me an invaluable lesson in confidence to be who I am, not who I’m “supposed” to be.

This month, my camp is dedicated to finding love and balance in everything we do. We’re going to work our asses off, but we’re also going to focus on taking care of ourselves in all areas of our lives.
✨
Physically – We’re going to workout 5-6 days/week, eat @kleanla, and drink 8 glasses of water/day.
💦
Emotionally – We’ll get plenty of sleep, we’ll say what we mean and mean what we say (but won’t say it mean), and we’ll get regular massages.
🙂
Personally – We’ll only surround ourselves with goodness from co-workers, friends, family, and loved ones. If we don’t have that in our lives, we’re going to figure out a way to develop it or I’m going to give consistent hugs.
🤗
This month, 26 women are going to give everything they have so they can GET everything they want. 💃🏼

Good Morning World... Here's what I think about not having enough time to workout. PS Hair not done by @jessegerman 😝

Sometimes in life we’re lucky enough to be caught in a perfect storm. That’s what happened to me and my team this week.
.
For 4 years I’ve been training my squads to find their inner warriors and their inner peace.... On some squads people hear me and sometimes people are so caught up in their own shit they look at me with a blank stare and say, “Yeah, yeah, yeah.” Listen, I don’t wake up at 5 a.m. and go to bed at midnight 6ish days a week to be talking some bullshit to anyone in my career.
.
No one on this REBOOT team said, “Yeah, yeah, yeah.” When I told them to dream, they dreamed. When I told them to suck it up, they sucked it up. When I told them to be kind they did. When I told them to rest, they did. When I told them to clap they did. When I told them how special they are, they believed it.
.
When I watched this team work out, I couldn’t help but think of the famous quote from the movie Field of Dreams: “If you build it...they will come.”
.
Thank you to ALL my LSF teams of 2017, you make everything in my life better. I can’t wait to see what kind of magic we create in 2018.... The year of the queen.
.

In order to become extraordinary at anything in life there's always an element of fear... It's crucial that we identify why we truly want to accomplish a goal, it must be bigger and more meaningful than "I want to look good." Why? Because who says you don't look good already... 😳😳😳 Your goals need to be rooted in passion and feeling... When your heart and mind are connected you become unstoppable. Make it about feeling and being your best every day all day. Striving to be the best person you can be from the inside out. If you can do this simple practice for a month or even just 7 days you'll see a definite change... Eat Right, Work Hard, Take Care of Yourself, & Be Good To Others.

Next time you see someone posing in a magazine, remember they don’t always look like that and there is probably a very tired-looking brunette under that highlighted blonde hair.

Crushed the hotel gym this morning with this nifty little core move with a classic piece of equipment. 🙌🏻 CORE MOVE: Grab a body bar that is heavy but not too heavy to execute the move (I'm using 10 lbs.). Make sure the bench is at a decline that doesn't compromise your lower back. Engaging your core throughout the entire exercise, slowly lower yourself to a decline position, then as you come up, powerfully lift the bar up above your head. Do it 20x for 3 sets. 🤙🏼🌺🤙🏼🌺

SEXY SUMMER SERIES: The Scissors is a great AB exercise to get you Beach Body Ready. 1. Start position both legs are lifted off the ground while you push the small of your back into the mat. 2. Alternate your right and left leg keeping them as straight as possible while continuing to push the small of your back into the ground. Do 3 sets of this exercise alternating your right and left leg to the mat 40x ☀️🏊🏻☀️🏊🏻☀️ Phot Cred @dasbinky location @betulumhotel 👌🏼

We are in week 3 of 1 Month Mission and I am so proud of this squad!!! 💫
I’ve been doing month camps for awhile, and I’ve found that there’s always some sort of drama that happens in everyone’s life every month. In this camp several people got sick, someone found out she had a brain aneurysm, someone is going through a tough divorce, and the list goes on and on for everyone.
😳
I find a lot of times people are waiting for life to get better and easier... I’m here to tell you that life will never get “easier”—you have to get stronger! My squad is learning to dance in the rain this month and we’ve become a family in only 3 short weeks.
💃🏼
Exercise: What shitty thing is going on in your life? How long have you been complaining about it and letting it destroy your light? If the answer is over a month, you must get out of your own way and be proactive against your pain. List 5 things you can do in the next 3 weeks to ease your pain and then do it. 🙌🏼
Everyone has a cross to bear in this world. The real heroes are the ones who keep on fighting and never give up on the hope in their hearts. Be your own hero. ❤️

Donut worry too much about your weight this Thanksgiving weekend. Get it?! 😳😆 Seriously, you can both indulge and stay on track this week if you follow a few easy guidelines.
1. Schedule workouts the day before, of, and after the holiday.
2. Don't try to lose weight for the next two weeks. Look to maintain.

3. No second helpings!
4. Keep portion sizes reasonable, making sure your food doesn't fill the whole plate or get higher than 2 inches above It.
5. If you've kept to the last point, eat whatever you want on Thursday.
I hope you have the best holiday week, everyone!

HERE’S MY TOP TEN WAYS TO FEEL ALIVE & ENERGIZED
1. Eat right
2. Be physically fit
3. Get plenty of rest
4. Drink plenty of water - 8-10 glasses
5. Make sure you do something nice for yourself every day
6. Get a massage every two weeks
7. Have one cup of coffee every morning
8. Surround yourself with people that make you happy
9. Stay away from a**holes as much as possible
10. Have a dream you’re working towards while remaining present in the now.

MOVE OF THE WEEK: Plank Walks (WORKS: Core.)
🔸 Place your forearms on the ground with your elbows aligned below your shoulders and arms parallel to the body at about shoulder-width distance. If flat palms bother your wrists, clasp your hands together. Then walk up with your right arm first followed by your left arm. After you are in push-up position, reach your right arm out and then reach your left arm out onto a step, which is directly in front of you. Hold that position for a two-count before walking your right hand followed by your left back to push-up position, and then your right arm followed by your left arm back to plank position.
🔸 Repeat the same movement starting on the left side until you’ve done 20 total reps, 10 on each side. Do this exercise for 3 sets.
✨ TIPS: Engage your entire body while doing the exercise, not just your core. Be sure to keep your body parallel to the ground. Don’t let your hips drop or your booty come up into a pike position.

I’ve been a tomboy my entire life. I don’t do dresses, high heels, a lot of makeup, or ringlets. I’ve only recently started to paint my nails, which is HUGE and makes my mom very happy! Hahaha!
😄
In the past I did a lot of shoots where people stuck chicken cutlets in my bra, retouched my photos to lessen the look of my muscles because they are “too intimidating,” I’ve had so much makeup on I felt like I should be in a drag show, or my favorite is when they’ve tried to make my hair look like a news reporter in the ’80s…. It’s AWFUL and makes me feel SO UNCOMFORTABLE and nothing like myself.
🙅🏼‍♀️
So I’ve gotta shout out @priv. Their hair stylists have found a way to make me fancy without losing who I am. They have slicked back my hair so I feel like Michael Douglas in “Wall Street” and braided my hair so I feel like an Amazon in “Wonder Woman.” They’ve found a way for me to own my feminine side without losing my masculine side. I’m not like every other woman and I don’t want to try to be…. PRIV lets me be ME, which has never happened before. Being a woman is hard, especially when people try to make you feel like who you are isn’t enough or isn’t “right.” Priv, you make me feel soft but strong, sexy, confident, and all the good things. Thank you for liking who I am and having a team that works to make me the best version of myself.
💜

Eeeekkk! 😳 Not all workouts are created equal. My Truth: I HATE RUNNING. You'd think me being a trainer I'd love running but the truth is I don't. From my years as a basketball player the pounding hurts my knees... I will sprint short distances but long distance actually makes me unhappy 😟 Here's the trick, try out as many workouts and teachers/trainers as possible. I promise you you'll find one you love, when you find that workout or that person stick to it... It's your go-to, mine are spin & lifting weights 🚴🏽💪🏼 Finding a good workout is like dating, don't go with someone that makes you feel gross... Go with someone that makes you light up inside 🔥⚡️🔥⚡️🔥That's your workout, that's your "person." Never settle for anything less, ok? 😃💪🏼❤️💪🏼❤️💪🏼

This month I'm going to share exercises you can do with body weight and a bench 👌🏼 This one will get your heart rate up while targeting your lower body and core. Take a peak and try it out, it's fun 💦💦💦

Abs off a bench is the bomb. Make sure your legs are going off the bench at a diagonal and when you bring your legs out from the tuck position they are straight while maintaining balance by mainly using your core not your arms and lower back. This is slightly an advanced move but I think anyone can give it a shot. Do 3sets of 20reps 3x this week 🙌🏼

MOVE OF THE WEEK: Roll-outs (WORKS: abs, lower back)
🔸Start in a plank position with elbows on the Swiss ball, then roll the ball out while keeping your abs engaged. Not only will this give you incredible core stability, but you may find that your nagging back issues will disappear too. 🔸Perform 3 sets of 10–20 reps.
🔸Nobody’s perfect—if you slip like I did, try to self-adjust without losing your balance. This exercise is challenging even to the experienced athlete. 😳🤗

MOVE OF THE WEEK: Forward/Backward/Lateral Speed Drill (WORKS: Footwork, Agility, Cardio)
🔸 Find a line on the ground that you can use as a marker for your footwork. Keep your body as compact as possible with a slight bend in your knees. If you don’t stay compact you won’t be able to move as quickly, and if your knees aren’t slightly bent, you could hurt yourself. The more compact your body is the more aggressively you can go after the movement.
🔸 Start Position: Hop forward and backward as quickly as you can 4 times. After you’ve completed your 4 hops, rotate your body to your side and hop 4 times again, before rotating back to the front.
🔸 After you’ve completed the set, repeat it 2 more times. Once you’ve finished a total of 12 forward/backward hops and 12 side/side hops, return to where you started by hopping backward.
🔸Rest for 20 seconds between repeating this exercise 4 times.
🔥
🔥
🔥
Words of Wisdom.

Assignment: Try reading this every morning when you wake up and if you have time right before you go to sleep. Try it for a month and watch it boost your spirit.

Most of the time, trainers and health pros will tell you not to try to lose weight during the holiday season and to focus on maintaining and getting stronger. I’ve been one of them, and we tell clients this because we want to set everyone up to SUCCEED, not to fail. There are just so many temptations this time of year, and we’re only human, right??
💁🏼
Well let me introduce you to one of the bootcampers on my squad, @AbbyBluestone, who just might be SUPERhuman. In my 2-week REBOOT camp, which started right after Thanksgiving, Abby lost a full 10 lbs., several inches around her waistline, and is feeling INCREDIBLE. She committed to herself and her health by giving her all at every bootcamp, cycling with me at @FlywheelSports, cutting out alcohol, and eating perfectly on @KleanLA’s program.
💪🏼
Abby, you are such an inspiration. Way to finish 2017 stronger than ever—I can’t wait to see what you do in 2018!

MOVE OF THE WEEK: Pike (WORKS: abs, booty, full body)—This move is hella good, yo!
💥Start by resting your shins on a stability ball. In a push-up position, keep your neck, spine, and hips in a neutral position. Your body should form a straight line. Your hands should be in line with your shoulders and slightly wider than shoulder-width. Fingers should face straight ahead. Abdominals muscles should be contracted.
💥With your knees straight, exhale and roll the ball toward your body. Raise your hips toward the sky as high as possible, ideally forming a 45° angle. Pause. Inhale and return to starting position.
💥Common mistakes:
– rounding the lower back at top of position
– hyperextending or flexing the neck (your neck should stay in line with your spine)
– over exercising the hip flexor muscles

SUMMER COCKTAILS TRICK! I like to drink, but when I coach camps with my teams I follow the NO DRINKING Camp Rule 😳 MY TRICK: I drink out of the same glass I'd have my "drink" and put tons of ice in it. Then I add lime & lemon w/ some mixed berries to my sparkling water. WHAT HAPPENS: The ice clinking the glass and the bubbly fizz fools your mind into thinking you're having an "actual" drink. Try it this summer, it's super refreshing & healthy! 🍋🍾🍉🍾🍓🍾

MOVE OF THE WEEK: Rebounding Abs (WORKS: Core)
🏀
This move was inspired by my Division I basketball scholarship to the University of Maine. When you rebound a basketball during a game, you often throw some elbows so the other team won’t be able to knock the ball out of your hands. While rotating your core, it becomes a great ab move with the medicine ball (in this video I’m using an 18 lb. ball.)
🔸Get in an upright kneeling position. Take the medicine ball to the right side of your body. While holding onto the ball on your right side, make sure both elbows are at about a 45-degree angle from your body. Quickly rotate the medicine ball to the opposite side of the body. Once the ball is rotated to the opposite side, quickly rotate back to the right side. Repeat for 1 minute.
🔸Once you’ve completed the 1 minute, switch knees and repeat the same movement on the other side. Do this exercise for 3 sets, 1 minute/set on both sides.
🏀🐅

MONDAY
Ride at @flywheel 2x 45mins each

Triceps Push-ups

TUESDAY -Rest

WEDNESDAY
Spin 2x - 45mins each
THURSDAY
Weights Upper & Lower Body
Abs 3 different exercises for 1min each
Alternating Forward Lunges 12reps each side 30lb Dbs
Lateral Flies - 12reps 15lb Dbs
FRIDAY
2x Spin - 45mins each

SATURDAY
1x Spin - 45mins
SUNDAY
1x Spin - 45mins

MOVE OF THE WEEK: This exercise focuses on strength and balance. Lift the medicine ball over your head while simultaneously lifting your right leg to a 90-degree angle. Slam the ball to the ground in a bowing motion while keeping your lifted leg off the ground. Once you complete a slam you may put your foot back on solid ground before repeating the exercise.

Do 15 reps on your right side and 15 reps on your left side for 3 sets.
TIPS: Have good posture and don’t slouch when slamming the ball to the ground. Be sure to engage your core and glutes for added support when balancing.
WORKS: Core, arms and legs

I got this one from my Baller dayz 🏀 Sitting on the ground, engage your glutes before you lift the slightly bent leg that’s opposite to the hand holding the ball. As soon as you catch the ball in the other hand, lift your other leg so your other hand has enough time to catch the ball.
Repeat this exercise for 20 reps (10 on each side) for 3 sets.

TIPS: It’s very important that you keep your spine in a lengthened position while doing this exercise — do not slouch your back. Keep space between your chin and your chest and don’t get discouraged. This exercise takes a lot of skill, but the more you practice the better you’ll get ❤️❤️❤️

MOVE OF THE WEEK: Extended Arm Plank CHALLENGE (High Plank), Works: Core
.
Here’s my first challenge of 2018. I’d like you to hold a high plank as long as you can. So get out your stopwatches or use your iPhone to time how long you can plank it out for me, OK? Once you’ve completed your challenge, post a picture of what you did and tag me so I can celebrate your accomplishment in my stories. FUN!
🔸Here’s what you do: Place your wrists directly under your shoulders, legs extended. Press through your heels so calves are lengthened. Draw your navel toward your spine and engage your glutes.
🔸Hold long should I hold? I want you to hold it as long as your body will allow with good form. I have had clients hold a high plank for 30 seconds, 2 minutes, or even 8 minutes. All I want is for you to commit to doing your best.

3-WAY?! I'm demonstrating 3 different ways you can use the treadmill to mix up your motivation during this Holiday season.
1. HIIT INTERVAL: Sprint at your fastest speed for 30seconds to 1min... Recover for 1-3 minutes before you do it again. I sprint at 10.0 and recover at 7.0 in this video for 20mins.

2. Steady state run, my least favorite style of run. Pick a speed you can comfortably hold for 30-45-60mins. In this video I did 7.0, in reality I rarely do steady state... I need a little more excitement in my Runs.

3. Hill Climb is when you put the incline at a level that doesn't hurt your shins. Run up the hill for 1-2mins then recover by bringing the inclined treadmill back to zero. Jog at a steady state until you feel ready to go up another hill. Do this workout for 20-30mins. In this video I did an Incline 9 and a speed of 5.5.

I’ve always been a big hugger. I even hug people after business meetings, which I’m not sure is the most appropriate. Ha.
❤️
FUN FACT: Did you know hugs are scientifically proven to add happiness to your life and the person you’re hugging?!
🤗
A 20-second hug increases levels of the "love hormone" oxytocin, which helps reduce the physical effects of stress, including its impact on your blood pressure and heart rate. Hugs are also known to lower levels of stress hormones like cortisol.
🤓
Another bonus is that hugs are free to give to anyone and everyone! The simple act of hugging makes the world a better place! So, I have one question for you: Who are you going to hug today? 😌

MOVE OF THE WEEK: Plank Hold Jump-overs (WORKS: Arms, Legs, Core, Agility [full-body plyometric cardio move])
🔸Start in an upright position. Drop down to the ground with your feet spread shoulder-width apart. Hold a strong plank and before getting back up, let your hips drop for a nice back stretch. When going from plank position to standing, be sure you land with your feet far enough apart so as not to compromise the knee joint. Once you feel stable on the ground, quickly do a double-foot lateral hop over the bench. Once you land on the other side, repeat the same exercise.
🔸Make sure you engage your core while doing all movements in this exercise. Less is more; take your time. I’d rather you do 8 quality moves than 20 half-assed ones.
🔸Do this exercise for 45 seconds. Take a 2-minute rest and repeat the exercise two more times. On every new cycle, try to beat the score you got on the one before.

MOVE OF THE WEEK: Speed Squats w/ Med Ball (WORKS: legs; core; shoulders; full-body, baby)
🔸Start with your feet shoulder-width apart and the ball cradled by your heart. Dip down into a squat position so your knees aren’t coming directly over your toes. As soon as you hit the low end of your squat, explode up pressing through your heals to standing position while simultaneously pressing the med ball over your head.
🔸Once you’ve completed one full repetition, repeat the exercise as quickly as you can for 1 minute. You should take a 30-second to 1-minute rest interval before completing the exercise 2 more times.
🔸EVERYONE’S WELCOME: Whether you’re an olympian or a beginner, you can make this exercise both fun and challenging. A beginner should start out with a 6 lb. med ball. If you’re an olympian or a very fit person, this exercise would be just as effective because he/she can use a 20–100 lb. med ball. How cool is that???

WORKOUT WEDNESDAY! Core month continues with the medicine ball core twist. Get in a lunge position, making sure your knees don't come over the tips of your toes. Do 12 reps on each side, 3x. The heavier, the harder. But start with a weight that allows you to maintain perfect form the whole way through. ⚫️💪🏼

MOVE OF THE WEEK (Works: Core): I’m gonna be honest, I don’t feel like explaining this one. Hahaha! Are you even reading this? Do you like how I made it black and white because the lyrics of the song say “give me that old school love right now”? Sometimes people get distracted by BS and miss little details in life.... I’m just pointing out I did that on purpose.
🎶
BASIC EXPLAINO OF THE MOVE
🔸Get in plank. The hand that taps the shoulder is the one that goes overhead like you’re in yoga class. Notice my feet are not stacked and are rotating as I rotate--do you see that?
🔸Go back to plank and do the same thing on the opposite side. Make sure to drop your hips a little in between the each rotation, just like you might do on a Friday night (JOKES!).
🔸Whenever doing an exercise try to be agile and not to stiff…. If you can’t bend, you’ll break inside and outside the gym.
😜

MOVE OF THE WEEK: Alternating Band Press (WORKS: Shoulders and a lil’-bit-o’-core)
🏋🏼‍♀️Start with your feet shoulder-width apart and the band running underneath both your right and left feet. Hold the band at shoulder level with your palms facing forward in both your right and left hands. Slightly turn your torso to your right while simultaneously pressing the band overhead. Once you’ve completed the movement, return to start position and repeat the same movement on the left side. Do the alternating shoulder torso turn as quickly as possible.
🥇Do this exercise for 1 minute, counting each rep on both the right and left sides. Take a 1-minute rest, and repeat the exercise 2 more times.
👌🏼TIP: When doing the second and third rounds, make an effort to better your best on the rep count. If you do 30 reps in the first round, try to do 32 reps in the second round and 34 in the fourth. Every little bit counts when you want to take your fitness to the next level.

@jess_lizama is small in size and shape, but anyone who’s tried to lose those last 5-10 lbs. knows it can be harder then losing the initial 20 lbs.

Look at Jess’s body and you may be surprised to read what changed. Sometimes when you’re working toward something, you realize your initial goal wasn’t as important as you thought it was.
.
JESS’S TRANSFORMATION STORY
💫
1. She spent $2500 on every workout and meal plan imaginable from every IG fitness model you can imagine and couldn’t get the results she was looking for.
2. It took her 2 LSF camps to see real change for the first time.
3. MY FAVORITE FACT: Jess GAINED 5 lbs. of muscle and dropped 4% body fat. She weighs MORE now-
—did you catch that? She weighs MORE now than before—but she’s gone down 2 sizes in clothes (from a 5/6 to a 2) and loves feeling stronger overall.
4. For the first time in her life, Jess loves and respects her body. She said she admires her thick legs (as she calls them), which she never loved before because they were never "in style.”

After I got the news, I was on my way to teach class in Larchmont, and I didn’t know how I was going to do it. It was 10 minutes before the class started, and there was no way we could find someone to teach a full class for me. So I had to suck up my emotions and teach. I didn’t tell the class what had happened because I didn’t want it to be real.
.
At Flywheel, you teach under a spotlight on stage. During the class, I looked up at the light and it flickered. It flickered like she was there telling me it would be OK. After the class ended, I ran out of the room and started to hysterically cry.
.
Annabel was gone...but I know she was in that room with me that day. And ever since, every time I teach under the light at Flywheel, I feel like she’s with me. Sometimes I look up at the light while I’m teaching but I’m really looking at her telling her I love her.
.
Every day I fight for my dreams because she doesn’t get to anymore. Under that spotlight I can’t get tired because I’m doing it for her. I’m living the life my friend no longer gets to. It’s how I honor her memory and keep her close.
.

It’s time to break the myth: Bread is not the devil, especially before you work out! 👹 I always start my day with some sort of multi-grain carbohydrate.
🍞
Why? Carbs are beneficial because they slow down the digestion process, which helps to fuel you throughout the day.
❤️
I like to have my bread with another villain healthy fat!!! (HINT: It’s not a villain either!) I dip my bread in olive oil, which is a natural oil extracted from olives, the fatty fruit of the olive tree.
🍞
Why? Olive oil contains large amounts of antioxidants that are biologically active and may help fight serious disease and can fight inflammation. It can also help prevent the cholesterol in our blood from becoming oxidized, both crucial steps in the heart disease process. And don’t forget it helps fight Alzheimer’s.
😳
😆
BOTTOM LINE: Have some bread and fat in the morning, it’s not going to kill you. In fact it’s good for you!!!

MOVE OF THE WEEK: Plank Dip Rotation (WORKS: Core)
🔸Start in a plank position. While holding a plank, rotate your body to one side, turning your feet so they are parallel to the ground and your body is forming a diagonal line. Hold that position for a second or two before returning to start position, allowing your hips to slightly dip to the floor before going back into a plank hold. Once you’ve completed the rotation and dip, repeat the same movement on the other side.
🔸Do this exercise for 45 seconds. Take a 1-minute rest and repeat the exercise 2 more times.
🔸POINTER 1: Make sure your shoulder joint is in alignment with your wrist while executing the whole movement. It’s not good to rush this exercise or any exercise ever. Remember to hold each position for a second or two before going to the next. I’m going fast because I’m fit as hell and need to look cool doing it. Just take your time and do your best, OK?
🔸POINTER 2: I like to add the dip because it releases tension on my lower back. Because I work out all the time, my back can get a little achy.... When I allow for a little stretch in between movements, it helps me flow into the moves in a less rigid way. This dip move is also great on Friday nights. 😏

MOVE OF THE WEEK: Diagonal Squats with a Slam (WORKS: Core, Legs, Full-Body Cardio Move)
🔸Start in a standing position with medicine ball directly in front of your heart. Do a 180 to your right while simultaneously moving into a squat. Once you’ve completed a full squat, return to start position taking the medicine ball overhead. Make sure both feet are planted before you slam the ball onto the floor. Once the ball bounces back into your hands, repeat the squat-slam sequence on the other side. 🔸Do this exercise for 1 minute. Take a 1-minute rest, and repeat the exercise 2 more times.
🔸TIP: When executing both moves, be sure to engage your core and wear a cute outfit.
😏

"Courage is not defined by those who fought and did not fall... It's defined by those who fought, fell, and rose again." Over the past 8 Weeks these 16 people have come together in ways I can't even explain. We battled together and through our struggles to be our best we became one. Every second matters, every person matters, and it takes courage to know that life isn't just about "winning." Thank you for your courage.

Lacey Stone Fitness is more than a workout, it's about creating an environment of of strength, leadership, & RESULTS ❤❤❤ I want to share an email I wrote to this team that explains why I'm so passionate about my programs. "Get to know people… Not on a superficial level but really get to know their stories. One of the greatest parts of my job is that people feel safe enough to tell me things they don’t tell everyone else. I get close to so many people and the common theme I’ve found is that we all want to feel heard and to feel loved. We’ve all had horrible sh*t happen to us that isn’t fair… We all want to give up sometimes and get off the rollercoaster of life. Here's the thing, life is a rollercoaster... so what if we stopped trying to get off and started to enjoy the ride with it’s ups and downs. If you start to trust life and enjoy the ride you may find that something didn't work out because you were destined for something better.

The more connected you feel to people the easier it is to get through… The more successful you get the more important it is to surround yourself with love and support. I want all of you to succeed in and outside of the gym. I share my pain with you and I fight for my happiness every day because I believe that's what we're meant to do.  Everyone's meant to have a great life it's just a matter of how hard you're willing to fight for it when it knocks you down."
I've always been a bit of a clown...
Happy Friday Friends!!!! 💃

NEW YEAR EXERCISE:
I use this exercise every year to break free of my self-imposed boundaries and create what’s possible for my future. It helps me stay on track, grateful, and inspired. I encourage you to try it—it will help set the tone for 2018.
🙌🏼
1. Write a list of everything you’re grateful for from 2017.
(Examples: I found @tiffanymorgan to be my new COO. No matter what adversity I faced, I didn’t lose my sparkle. Everyone who has ever worked out with me.)
2. Tally up everything you accomplished in 2017.
(Examples: I was cast for season 2 of @RevengeBody. I helped hundreds of people change their bodies and lives.)
3. Set goals for yourself personally, professionally, and physically for 2018 that seem so impossible and lofty you might not typically share with others.
(Examples: Build an international fitness brand. Be on a billboard on Sunset Blvd. Help millions of people change their bodies and lives.)
4. For the next 365 days, re-read your dream goals and put in the effort every single day to make them happen.
💥
How many dream goals you want to accomplish is limitless. Once you write down what you’re grateful for, what you accomplished, and what you want in your future, I promise you’ll get super excited for what’s to come. Anything is possible if you have the courage to pursue it.
Well that's a nice way to think about it isn't it? Happy Friday nigghhhhttttttt 💃

Every week, it’s my job to make electric workout playlists designed to help my students get lost so they can perform to levels they never thought possible. People don’t realize that great instructors don’t just throw playlists together. Designing a good playlist is an art and sometimes takes over an hour to make.
🎶
My playlists are layered with mantras, HIIT intervals for results, and a story line. I like to imagine I’m making a soundtrack to a movie every ride I lead. Love, loss, inspiration, and fun is the journey I take my riders on every time we sweat.
✨
Next time you take my class, yes, kick ass, but also take a moment to listen to the magic of the music. It will give you something else to focus on and maybe inspire you in ways you didn’t even know were there.
🚴🏼‍♀️
Playlist link in bio.

Rest, relaxation and sleep.... 😌😌😌 I fall victim to the go go go as much as anyone else, but what I’ve learned this year is it’s not sustainable even if you’re mentally tough enough to plow through. Without rest your body, mind, and most important, soul, don’t have time to recover and process. You are at risk of injury, loss of focus, depression, anxiety, and loss of altruistic motivation. ✨❤️ Next week do one thing that will restore your spirit and help you slow down, OK? 🛀 💆🏼 😴
